text: The Arrowhead Region is in the northeastern part of the U.S. state of Minnesota. It got its name from its pointed shape. The mainly rural region is 27,636 kmÂ² (10,670 sq mi) of land area and comprises Carlton, Cook, Lake and St. Louis Counties. At the 2020 census 252,943 people lived there. ==References== *Counties of the Arrowhead Region, Minnesota United States Census Bureau ==Other websites== *Northland Connection Local website Category:Geography of Minnesota
title: Arrowhead Region
